sentences: Uusi laki tulee voimaan ensi vuonna.
context: The word 'laki' in Finnish has multiple meanings, most commonly referring to a law or statute. It can also refer to the general concept of law as a system, or even a physical summit or ceiling depending on context. The declension patterns show how the word changes based on its grammatical role in a sentence (nominative, genitive, etc.).  The plural form 'lait' is used when referring to multiple laws.
